title: MOUSAI APOLLONIDES
content:
THE MOUSAI APOLLONIDES were three younger Muses, daughters of the god Apollon. They were honoured at the shrine
        of Delphoi where one, Kephiso (Cephiso), was named after a local river. The three were sometimes called Nete,
        Mese, and Hypate after the lowest, middle and highest strings of the lyre.

The Apollonides were one of three sets of Muses--the others being the Olympian Nine
        and the Titanid Three.

APOLLON (Eumelus Frag
            35, Tzetzes on Hesiod 23)

[1.1] KEPHISO, APOLLONIS, BORYSTHENIS (Eumelus Frag 35, Tzetzes on Hesiod 23) 
        [2.1] NETE, MESE, HYPATE (Plutarch Symposium 9.14)

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
